<<<<<<< HEAD
Mirrha the mother of Adonis: or, Lustes prodegies. By William Barksted. Horrace. Nansicetur enim pretium, nomenque poetæ. Whereunto are added certaine Eglogs. By L.M. Barksted, William, fl. 1611. Machin, Lewis, fl. 1609.
[80] p.
Printed by E. A[llde] for Iohn Bache, and are to be sold at his shop in the Popes-head Palace, nere the Royall Exchange, London : 1607.
L.M. = L. Machin. In verse. Printer's name from STC. "Three Eglogs" by Lewis Machin has separate title page; register is continuous. Signatures: A-E. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

[80] p.
Printed by E. A[llde] for Iohn Bache, and are to be sold at his shop in the Popes-head Palace, nere the Royall Exchange, London : 1607.
L.M. = L. Machin. In verse. Printer's name from STC. "Three Eglogs" by Lewis Machin has separate title page; register is continuous. Signatures: A-E. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
Iohn Bache
E. A[llde]
his shop in the Popes-head Palace, nere the Royall Exchange
